column4: hi! my question: how can I make my ubuntu use gcc-3.4? it's always trying to use the latest version.
in your console (for temporary use) type "export CC=/usr/bin/gcc-3.4"  for permantent use, add that line to your ~/.bashrc
CC=/usr/bin/gcc-3.4 | gcc --version says version is 4.0. what can I do?
